messages.message: Possibly urgent? We are seeing a bunch of `out` directories getting deleted over the past 48 hours. Just in case this is actually worrisome, gonna risk the <!here> blast
I think sales folks noticed this, and I just noticed this about 15 minutes ago cc @Lee
Editing and redeploying job-service. Jobs are retained for two weeks currently. Likely have multiple jobs sharing the same output dir. The older job's cleanup cleans up the new job's output
But wouldn’t we then expect the new job to replace it with new output? Is there a way to validate this is true?
I’ve seen this happen when I run once without ‘run with id’ checked to create the /out. Then I run again with it checked and I get the /out-username and the /out has gone.
For me I didn’t run anything, it just disappeared randomly :confused:
^ While the re-deploy happens, does anyone have a simple way to replicate this? Haven't faced this issue before.
Redeploy is now done, feel free to drop another ping if this happens again after now
@Anil what did we change here? the cleanup time?

i understand the need for auto-cleanup and also understand how this causes inconvenience for things like demo. maybe we make if a flow output get removed in a certain time period an option from the UI / API when triggering the run

^^ Yup bumped clean up time to 10 years
Shaunak's intern will work on fixing this so that we clear folders when run-id is present.
let’s chat about this tomorrow too and see if we can surface this as an option from the ui / api
I am seeing it too -- `out/s1_process_files` missing in some flow runs
ah.. and since I do demo on same folder -- some old runs clean it up
